events.name: China's Economic Expansion in Q2 2023
events.wd_description: China's economy expanded by 6.3% in the second quarter of 2023 compared to the previous year, driven by a low base from last year's COVID-19 lockdowns.
events.description: China's economy expanded by 6.3% in the second quarter of 2023 compared to the previous year, driven by a low base from last year's COVID-19 lockdowns.

events.name: GDP Growth
events.wd_description: China's gross domestic product grew by 6.3% year-on-year in Q2 2023, with a quarterly growth of 0.8% from April to June.
events.description: China's gross domestic product grew by 6.3% year-on-year in Q2 2023, with a quarterly growth of 0.8% from April to June.

events.name: Industrial Output Increase
events.wd_description: In June, China's industrial output expanded by 4.4%.
events.description: In June, China's industrial output expanded by 4.4%.

events.name: Fixed Asset Investment Rise
events.wd_description: Fixed asset investment in China rose by 3.8% in June.
events.description: Fixed asset investment in China rose by 3.8% in June.

events.name: Record High Youth Unemployment
events.wd_description: The jobless rate for Chinese youth aged 16 to 24 reached a new record high of 21.34% in June, surpassing the previous record of 20.8% set in May.
events.description: The jobless rate for Chinese youth aged 16 to 24 reached a new record high of 21.34% in June, surpassing the previous record of 20.8% set in May.

events.name: Record-breaking global temperatures
events.wd_description: Global temperatures reached unprecedented levels, with the hottest days on record being observed in early July 2023, during the return of the El Niño phenomenon.
events.description: Global temperatures reached unprecedented levels, with the hottest days on record being observed in early July 2023, during the return of the El Niño phenomenon.

events.name: El Niño phenomenon
events.wd_description: The El Niño phenomenon, associated with warmer global temperatures, was confirmed to have returned, contributing to the record-breaking heat.
events.description: The El Niño phenomenon, associated with warmer global temperatures, was confirmed to have returned, contributing to the record-breaking heat.

events.name: July 2023 temperature records
events.wd_description: July 4, 2023, recorded the highest-ever daily global temperature of 17.18°C, breaking the previous day's record of 17.01°C.
events.description: July 4, 2023, recorded the highest-ever daily global temperature of 17.18°C, breaking the previous day's record of 17.01°C.

events.name: Regional temperature extremes
events.wd_description: Various regions experienced extreme temperatures, with averages of 35°C in parts of China, 50°C in North Africa, and 8.7°C in Antarctica.
events.description: Various regions experienced extreme temperatures, with averages of 35°C in parts of China, 50°C in North Africa, and 8.7°C in Antarctica.

events.name: Italy Imposes Windfall Tax on Banks
events.wd_label: Italy Imposes Windfall Tax on Banks
events.wd_description: Italy has imposed a one-off windfall tax on local banks to address the extra profits they have made from rising interest rates, with proceeds to support mortgage holders and cut taxes.
events.description: Italy has imposed a one-off windfall tax on local banks to address the extra profits they have made from rising interest rates, with proceeds to support mortgage holders and cut taxes.

events.name: Tax Approval
events.wd_description: The Italian government approved the windfall tax in a cabinet meeting, planning to use the proceeds to support mortgage holders and reduce taxes.
events.description: The Italian government approved the windfall tax in a cabinet meeting, planning to use the proceeds to support mortgage holders and reduce taxes.

events.name: Rationale Behind the Tax
events.wd_description: Deputy Prime Minister Matteo Salvini highlighted that banks' profits in the first half of 2023, driven by the European Central Bank’s rate hikes, justify the tax.
events.description: Deputy Prime Minister Matteo Salvini highlighted that banks' profits in the first half of 2023, driven by the European Central Bank’s rate hikes, justify the tax.

events.name: Expected Revenue
events.wd_description: The government plans to tax 40% of the extra income stream from rising interest rates, with an estimated revenue of up to €4.9 billion from Italy's 10 largest publicly listed banks.
events.description: The government plans to tax 40% of the extra income stream from rising interest rates, with an estimated revenue of up to €4.9 billion from Italy's 10 largest publicly listed banks.

events.name: Analysts' Reaction
events.wd_description: Equity analysts, including Jefferies, noted that the decision to tax the net interest margin was unexpected.
events.description: Equity analysts, including Jefferies, noted that the decision to tax the net interest margin was unexpected.
